events.originalText: Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud was appointed the crown prince of Saudi Arabia.
events.subtitle: Salman of Saudi Arabia
events.headline: Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud appointed crown prince of Saudi Arabia

events.originalText: NASA launched the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter, its first mission to the Moon in more than ten years.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA launches Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter to the Moon

events.originalText: The Troubles: Ulster Volunteer Force members attacked a crowded bar in Loughinisland, Northern Ireland, with assault rifles, killing six.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Ulster Volunteer Force members attack bar in Loughinisland, Northern Ireland, killing six

events.originalText: Aboard Space Shuttle Challenger, astronaut Sally Ride became the first American woman and third one overall in space.
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Challenger
events.headline: Sally Ride becomes first American woman in space aboard Space Shuttle Challenger

events.originalText: Iranian teenager Mona Mahmudnizhad and nine other women were hanged in Shiraz because of their membership in the Baháʼí Faith.
events.subtitle: Mona Mahmudnizhad
events.headline: Iranian teenager Mona Mahmudnizhad hanged in Shiraz for Baháʼí Faith membership

events.originalText: The body of Italian banker Roberto Calvi, nicknamed "God's Banker" due to his close association with the Holy See, was found hanging from scaffolding beneath London's Blackfriars Bridge.
events.subtitle: Roberto Calvi
events.headline: Body of Italian banker Roberto Calvi found hanging from scaffolding in London

events.originalText: The Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk, the first operational aircraft to be designed around stealth technology, made its maiden flight.
events.subtitle: Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk
events.headline: Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk makes maiden flight

events.originalText: British European Airways Flight 548 crashed near Staines-upon-Thames less than three minutes after departing from Heathrow Airport in London, killing all 118 people aboard in the worst air accident in the UK.
events.subtitle: British European Airways Flight 548
events.headline: British European Airways Flight 548 crashes near Staines-upon-Thames, killing all 118 aboard

events.originalText: American musician Jimi Hendrix burned his guitar on stage at the end of a performance at the Monterey International Pop Festival in California.
events.subtitle: Jimi Hendrix
events.headline: Jimi Hendrix burns guitar on stage at Monterey International Pop Festival

events.originalText: Benjamin Britten's one-act opera Noye's Fludde premiered at the Aldeburgh Festival.
events.subtitle: Benjamin Britten
events.headline: Benjamin Britten's opera Noye's Fludde premieres at Aldeburgh Festival

events.originalText: Carlos Castillo Armas led a CIA-sponsored invasion force across the Guatemalan border, beginning the 1954 Guatemalan coup d'état.
events.subtitle: Carlos Castillo Armas
events.headline: Carlos Castillo Armas leads invasion force in 1954 Guatemalan coup d'état

events.originalText: A Douglas C-124 Globemaster II aircraft crashed just after takeoff from Tachikawa, Japan, killing all 129 people on board.
events.subtitle: Douglas C-124 Globemaster II
events.headline: Douglas C-124 Globemaster II aircraft crashes in Japan, killing all 129 on board

events.originalText: World War II: Charles de Gaulle gave his Appeal of 18 June speech, often considered to be the origin of the French Resistance.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Charles de Gaulle gives Appeal of 18 June speech, origin of French Resistance

events.originalText: Charles Darwin received a manuscript by fellow naturalist Alfred Russel Wallace on natural selection, which encouraged him to publish his own theory of evolution.
events.subtitle: Charles Darwin
events.headline: Charles Darwin receives manuscript on natural selection from Alfred Russel Wallace

events.originalText: War of the Seventh Coalition: Napoleon fought and lost his final battle, the Battle of Waterloo (depicted), in present-day Belgium.
events.subtitle: Hundred Days
events.headline: Napoleon loses final battle at Battle of Waterloo in Belgium

events.originalText: Third Silesian War: The Austrian victory at the Battle of Kolín forced Prussian leader Frederick the Great to give up the Siege of Prague and retreat to Saxony.
events.subtitle: Third Silesian War
events.headline: Austrian victory at Battle of Kolín forces Frederick the Great to retreat

events.originalText: Rus' forces sailed into the Bosporus in a fleet of about 200 vessels and started pillaging the suburbs of Constantinople.
events.subtitle: Rus' Khaganate
events.headline: Rus' forces pillage suburbs of Constantinople

events.originalText: Sui–Tang transition: Chinese governor Li Yuan (pictured) declared himself emperor, establishing the Tang dynasty.
events.subtitle: Transition from Sui to Tang
events.headline: Chinese governor Li Yuan declares himself emperor, establishing Tang dynasty
